macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Dip Slightly Near Records Amid Mixed Economic Data
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.06-0.1% to 6940 points, Dow dropped 0.2% to around 49,359, and Nasdaq edged up 0.16% on January 16, 2026. JOLTS showed sharp drop in job openings signaling cooling labor demand, ADP reported modest private hiring rebound, and ISM Services PMI beat expectations.[1][2]

items.title: Banks Weigh on Dow as JPMorgan and Bank of America Fall Over 2%
items.summary: JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America declined more than 2%, dragging the Dow, while regional bank PNC rose 3.8% after beating Q4 targets but Regions Financial fell 2.6% on missed forecasts. Tech stocks like Alphabet (+2.5%) and NVIDIA (+1%) supported Nasdaq gains.[1][2]

items.title: Semiconductor Strength with Broadcom Up 2.5% and Micron Soaring 7.8%
items.summary: Big tech and semiconductors led market moves, with Broadcom rising 2.5% and Micron Technology jumping 7.8%, offsetting losses in cyclical sectors like industrials, materials, and financials. Russell 2000 small caps gained 0.1%.[2]

items.title: Treasury Yields Rise as 10-Year Hits 4.23% and 2-Year at 3.60%
items.summary: The 10-year Treasury yield increased to 4.23% from 4.17%, and the 2-year yield rose to 3.60% from 3.57%, reflecting expectations around Federal Reserve policy. Gold prices fell 0.6% but remain up over 5% in January.[2]

items.title: Energy Stocks Mixed on Venezuelan Crude Flows and Softer Prices
items.summary: Valero and Marathon Petroleum advanced on reports of renewed Venezuelan crude flows benefiting Gulf Coast refiners, while Chevron lagged amid declining crude prices.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Surges Above $97,000 in First Major 2026 Rally
items.summary: Bitcoin hit a high over $97,000 and Ethereum neared $3,400 amid the first significant crypto rally of 2026, with Solana peaking at $148. Crypto ETF inflows reached $1.2 billion in the last five trading days, signaling strong institutional accumulation.

items.title: Spot Bitcoin ETFs See $1.7 Billion Inflows in Three Days
items.summary: Confirmed inflows into spot Bitcoin ETFs exceeded $1.7 billion from January 13-15, 2026, potentially signaling a super cycle toward $100,000 according to analysts.

items.title: Senate Delays Vote on CLARITY Act After Industry Split
items.summary: The Senate Banking Committee delayed a markup vote on the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act of 2025 after Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong withdrew support, amid mixed reactions from crypto leaders aiming to clarify SEC-CFTC oversight.

items.title: XRP On-Chain Activity Hits 180-Day High at 1.45M Transactions
items.summary: XRP Ledger recorded 1.45 million daily transactions on January 13, the highest in six months, driven by payments, tokenized assets, and DeFi, though price lingers at $2.10 with analysts predicting a potential breakout.

items.title: XRP Treasury Firm Evernorth Plans Nasdaq IPO in 2026
items.summary: Evernorth, holding 388 million XRP tokens, will go public on Nasdaq, joining Kraken, Consensys, and Ledger in a wave of crypto IPOs expected in 2026 amid growing Wall Street adoption of blockchain.

items.title: CME to Launch 24/7 Crypto Futures for Cardano, Chainlink, Stellar
items.summary: CME plans 24/7 crypto futures and options trading starting early 2026, including Cardano, Chainlink, and Stellar, pending regulatory approval, legitimizing derivatives for institutional traders.

items.title: Crypto Scams Reach Record $14B in 2025 Fueled by AI
items.summary: Illicit crypto addresses received at least $14 billion in 2025, up sharply due to AI-enhanced scams averaging $3.2 million per operation, with Chainalysis projecting over $17 billion as data finalizes.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Gartner Forecasts Global AI Spending to Reach $2.52 Trillion in 2026
items.summary: Gartner predicts worldwide AI spending will hit $2.52 trillion in 2026, a 44% year-over-year increase, driven by AI infrastructure and optimized servers, though ROI remains elusive amid the 'Trough of Disillusionment'. AI models and platforms for data science are expected to grow rapidly from 2025 levels.

items.title: Wikimedia Foundation Adds Six AI Companies as Enterprise Partners
items.summary: On its 25th birthday, Wikimedia signed Ecosia, Microsoft, Mistral AI, Perplexity, Pleias, and ProRata as enterprise partners, granting them preferential API access to Wikipedia content to support responsible AI development.

items.title: Data Management Trends for 2026: AI-Driven Shift to Lakehouses and Vector Support
items.summary: In 2026, data management evolves with AI, favoring lakehouses like Unity Catalog for unified analytics and ML, native vector embeddings for RAG, and Apache Iceberg as the open table standard, moving away from monolithic warehouses.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Amazon's New World: Aeternum Delisted, Shutdown Scheduled for January 31, 2027
items.summary: Amazon's MMORPG New World: Aeternum was delisted on January 15, 2026, with the game set to go offline completely on January 31, 2027. The Rust director has offered $25 million to acquire and keep the game alive.

items.title: Krafton Announces 26 Games in Development, Pursuing 'Big Franchise IP'
items.summary: South Korean gaming company Krafton revealed it has 26 games in progress, with 12 titles scheduled to launch within two years including Subnautica 2 and Palworld Mobile. The company is focusing on creating sustainable franchise IPs that extend beyond single games.

items.title: Ubisoft Reaffirms Commitment to The Division Franchise
items.summary: Ubisoft confirmed its ongoing commitment to The Division 2, The Division 2 Survivors, The Division Resurgence, and The Division 3, with new content including The Gaming Brigade arm patch and backpack.

items.title: Nearly 80% of Japanese Game Developers Report Income Increases
items.summary: According to a CESA survey of 339 Japanese game developers, 79.5% reported annual income increases in 2025, with 19.5% seeing gains exceeding 20%. Only 6.8% reported income declines.

items.title: Toge Productions Celebrates 17th Anniversary with New Game Announcements
items.summary: Toge Productions held its 17th Anniversary Direct event on January 15, 2026, announcing new titles including Moses & Plato: Last Train to Clawville and Undusted: Letters from the Past.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trump Pushes Big Tech to Fund New Power Plants for Data Centers
items.summary: President Trump proposes compelling technology companies to finance new power infrastructure to support data centers, potentially funding $50 billion in investments amid rising energy demands. Microsoft and others are increasing electricity investments in response.

items.title: White House Calls 25% Tariff on Nvidia AI Chips 'Phase One' Action
items.summary: A White House official states the US Commerce Department's 25% national security tariff on high-end semiconductors, including Nvidia's H200 chips for export to China under strict conditions, is only the initial step with potential for higher tariffs up to 100%. Further measures depend on talks with trade partners.

items.title: Hardware Firms Face Rising Memory Chip Costs Amid Strong Demand
items.summary: Hardware companies are hit by increasing memory chip prices due to high demand driven by semiconductor needs, with stocks like SanDisk up 5.5% and Micron in the high teens in premarket trading. TSMC highlighted ongoing demand pressures.

items.title: Starlink Plans 2026 IPO as Milestone for Satellite Internet
items.summary: Tech experts view Starlink's planned initial public offering in 2026 as a significant milestone advancing the satellite internet industry.

items.title: US FTC to Scrutinize Big Tech's 'Acqui-Hire' Talent Deals
items.summary: The US Federal Trade Commission, led by Chairman Andrew Ferguson, is examining big tech firms' practice of hiring startup talent and licensing technology without full acquisitions to avoid antitrust reviews. Recent examples include Nvidia with Groq, Microsoft, Meta, and Amazon deals.
